timeline.bodyText: looking at prior art on maven, I think we can change this to "azure-core-dependencies" and drop the 'external' and 'bom'
timeline.author: joshfree

replies.bodyText: Name changed, also adding another commit trying out adding all track 2 external dependencies into the azure-sdk-bom.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.message: Renamed module, removed invalid dependency, commented out dependency that breaks dependency checker
Add all external compile time dependencies to azure-sdk-bom

replies.bodyText: This package doesn't exist and, because it doesn't exist, this dependency tag isn't used anywhere.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Should the name be updated to azure-core-dependencies-bom?
timeline.author: srnagar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,51 @@
+# Azure external dependencies BOM for libraries and services
+The Azure external dependencies BOM for libraries provides all shared artifacts that are used in Java development for
+Azure. It provides a simple and elegant way to manage dependencies for multiple Azure libraries and services.
+
+## Table of contents
+- [Getting started](#getting-started)
+  - [Adding the BOM to your project](#adding-the-bom-to-your-project)
+  - [Adding libraries to your project](#adding-libraries-to-your-project)
+
+## Getting started
+
+### Adding the BOM to your project
+
+To consume the BOM include it in the `dependencyManagement` section of your project's POM. Note that this **does not**
+result in all dependencies being included in your project.
+
+```xml
+<dependencyManagement>
+  <dependencies>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>com.azure</groupId>
+      <artifactId>azure-external-dependencies-bom</artifactId>

replies.bodyText: Yes, if this is being kept this should be renamed to azure-core-dependencies.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Should this be core-dependencies or external-dependencies? I think core can be confusing as it seems like it's related to azure-core artifact.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: Should we have all spring boot dependencies in this bom or is it better to keep this bom for only maintaining external dependencies used in client libraries?
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: I think the right bet going forward would be combining the SDK/Spring library being shipped and their external libraries. Having these split will just move the spot where dependency conflicts happen, or maybe we would need to create a BOM of BOMs which isn't the most ideal (nor do I know if it actually works).
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.message: Remove azure-core-dependencies BOM, updated external dependencies to match versions
Fix a few versions, disable build failing on version conflicts
Merged in master, updated README to discuss inclusion of library dependencies
Update to versions released in June
Update BOM versions based on final June releases

timeline.bodyText: "After adding the BOM, Azure..." there should be a comma after the prepositional phrase.
timeline.author: JimSuplizio
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -30,8 +32,8 @@ result in all dependencies being included in your project.
 
 ### Adding libraries to your project
 
-After adding the BOM all artifacts included in the BOM are now available to be added as a dependency without listing the
-artifact's version.
+After adding the BOM Azure client libraries included in the BOM are now available to be added as a dependency without

timeline.bodyText: Why is this being commented out? If it needs to be removed then it should be removed entirely.
timeline.author: JimSuplizio

replies.bodyText: Commented it out as we want to have this enabled but a few of the external dependencies conflict in their dependencies. I've filed a few issues against @JonathanGiles's plugin to add support for dependency inclusions/exclusions when running the report to get around them. They are trivial things that are second order dependencies that aren't a priority with what we want to present here.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Now that we have combined Azure client libraries and external dependencies into a single bom, this is no longer required.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: nit: it would be nice to have these dependencies listed in sorted order (separate external and azure sorted lists).
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: Dependencies are separated into SDK and external, sort order may not have been applied to the sections though.
replies.author: alzimmermsft
